text:
Wednesday, 22 February 2017 | MYT 10:24 AM Japanese pool player becomes famous for bizarre interviews by rashvinjeet s. bedi 
PETALING JAYA: Most sportsmen and athletes are full of clichés in their interviews, but one Japanese pool player made sure that his post-game interviews would be forever remembered. 
Naoyuki Oi’s zany interview with Sky Sports presenter Tony Wrighton during the World Pool Masters in Gibraltar recently has been widely shared on social media, making people laugh. 
“My name is Naoyuki Oi. Today very lucky. Congratulations me. Yay,” he said with his hands up to a question by Wrighton on his win to book a place in the quarterfinals of the tournament. 
“English a little. No problem,” he added. 
Wrighton who looked bemused, then asked Oi if he had blown his chances at one point in the match, Oi replies animatedly “I have a pen, I have an apple…Ooo eee..apple pen,” with his hands mimicking the action of a pen entering an apple. 
Wrighton who is now laughing to himself says, “I’ve never done anything like this before.” 
But it doesn’t end there as Wrighton then asks Oi if he could win the tournament. 
Oi ponders a little before saying “no problem.” 
Unfortunately though, Oi was knocked out in the quarterfinals. 
When quizzed again by Wrighton on his loss, Oi sys “Excuse me, can I speak English..you, me. No English, No problem. Everytime happy,” he says with his hands in the air. 
He then proceeds with another “apple pen” routine before saying “Oh My God…Thank you. Go. Go home. I go home,” he said looking clearly distressed this time. Related Stories
